title: Minerva: A File-Based Ransomware Detector
authors: Dorjan Hitaj, Giulio Pagnotta, Fabio De Gaspari, Lorenzo De Carli, Luigi V. Mancini

authors: Ahmed Bensaoud, Jugal Kalita, Mahmoud Bensaoud
abstract_summary: Comprehensive survey of deep learning methods for malware detection across multiple OS (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android). Addresses interpretability challenges and adversarial vulnerabilities.

authors: Shenao Wang, Feng Dong, Hangfeng Yang, Jingheng Xu, Haoyu Wang
abstract_summary: Real-time ransomware detection with 30ms inference, tested on 1761 ransomware variants. 91% CPU reduction, deployed on 3.32M endpoints with 61 prevented attacks.

title: Mind The Gap: Can Air-Gaps Keep Your Private Data Secure?
authors: Mordechai Guri
abstract_summary: Surveys cyber incidents targeting air-gap networks, discusses adversarial attacks for data exfiltration from isolated systems, proposes defensive countermeasures.

authors: Muhammad Husni Santriaji, Jiaqi Xue, Qian Lou, Yan Solihin
abstract_summary: Combines FHE with algorithm-based fault tolerance for verifiable encrypted computation. IEEE S&P 2025 venue. Addresses data integrity in cloud computing.

authors: Nicolas Reategui, Roman Pletka, Dionysios Diamantopoulos
abstract_summary: Kernel-based framework for ransomware detection at storage level using IO operations. 12.8% higher F1 scores, 17.1% lower false positive rates.

authors: Sileshi Nibret Zeleke, Amsalu Fentie Jember, Mario Bochicchio
abstract_summary: XGBoost-based malware detection in encrypted traffic without decryption. 99.32% accuracy, SHAP explainability analysis. 54 malware families detected.

authors: Hossein Shokouhinejad, Roozbeh Razavi-Far, Hesamodin Mohammadian, Mahdi Rabbani, Samuel Ansong, Griffin Higgins, Ali A Ghorbani

authors: Aishwarya Parab, Prakhar Pradhan, Yogesh Simmhan, Arnab K. Paul

authors: Quinn Burke, Ryan Sheatsley, Yohan Beugin, Eric Pauley, Owen Hines, Michael Swift, Patrick McDaniel
abstract_summary: PAC hybrid approach for storage integrity. 5.5X throughput improvement over state-of-art. IEEE S&P 2025. Defers write commitments while ensuring read integrity.

authors: Abrar Fahim, Shamik Dey, Md. Nurul Absur, Md Kamrul Siam, Md. Tahmidul Huque, Jafreen Jafor Godhuli

abstract_summary: Survey of visualization-based malware detection across platforms (desktop, mobile, IoT). Analyzes 100+ research articles, proposes evaluation framework.

authors: Chris M. Ward, Josh Harguess
abstract_summary: Identifies prompt injection, data poisoning, and adversarial manipulation attacks on RAG systems. Proposes risk management framework with control mitigation.

authors: Can Zheng, Yuhan Cao, Xiaoning Dong, Tianxing He
abstract_summary: Shows multi-agent LLM integrity attacks bypass GPT-4o and o3-mini monitors. Demonstrates Scapegoater, Boaster, Self-Dealer, Free-Rider attack patterns.

authors: Krishnendu Das
abstract_summary: Lattice-based homomorphic hash with constant-time incremental updates. Quantum-resistant, scalable for distributed systems.

authors: Md Raz, Meet Udeshi, P.V. Sai Charan, Prashanth Krishnamurthy, Farshad Khorrami, Ramesh Karri
abstract_summary: LLM-autonomous ransomware with runtime code synthesis from natural language prompts. Tested across personal, enterprise, embedded systems.

authors: Lauren Deason et al. (23 authors)
abstract_summary: Open-source benchmark for LLM security capabilities. Larger models perform better, current LLMs far from saturation on cybersecurity tasks.

authors: Gyeonghoon Park, Jaehan Kim, Jinu Choi, Jinwoo Kim
abstract_summary: Linux cryptomining malware detection using sketch-based syscall monitoring and deep learning. 0.06% CPU overhead, eBPF-based evasion response.

authors: Daniel M. Jimenez-Gutierrez, Enrique Zuazua, Joaquin Del Rio, Oleksii Sliusarenko, Xabi Uribe-Etxebarria
